Package frc.robot

Class Lib4150AdvancedPID

java.lang.Object
frc.robot.Lib4150AdvancedPID
public class Lib4150AdvancedPID extends Object
Advanced PID controller class. Contains a number of enhancements over the WPILIB PID, including: auto/manual mode, online tuning without I term reset, I windup remediation.
File: filename.java

Referenceable items: (classes)
filename

Depends on:
none - no external libraries required

Operating system specifics:
None - transportable

Notes:

  • Constructor Details

    • Lib4150AdvancedPID

      public Lib4150AdvancedPID(double Kp, double Ki, double Kd, double Kf, double Kn)
      Creates a Lib4150AdvancedPID object with the provided tuning parameters.
      Parameters:
      Kp - - double - Proportional gain constant.
      Ki - - double - Integral gain constant.
      Kd - - double - Derivative gain constant.
      Kf - - double - Feedforware gain constant.
      Kn - - double - Normalization gain constant. When this is 1.0, tuning constants have "CO" relative units, otherwise tuning constants have "PV" relative units.

  • Method Details

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the PID controller. All saved errors, integrals, and other values used to calculate output are reset to zero.

    • atSetpoint

      public boolean atSetpoint()
      Determine if the controller is within tolerance. Returns true when the error has been within tolerance. Note that the error is sometimes referred to as "position" error. However the error units are often not distance units. The error units could be speed, position, or something else.
      Returns:
      atSetpoint - boolean - TRUE when error is within tolerance.

    • AdvPIDExec

      public double AdvPIDExec(double PV, double SP, double FF, boolean auto, double systemTime)
      Calculate the control output CO for this controller provided the process variable (PV), setpoint (SP), and feedforward (FF). Auto/Manual status and system elapsed time (seconds) must also be provided. This control uses this classis PIDF algorithm to calculate the control output: CO = Kf * FF + Kp * error + Ki * integral of error + Kd * derivative of error Anti-integral windup is performed so the output limits are not exeeded. This speeds the response of the controller when integral saturation occurs. In manual mode the output is calculated as: CO = Kf * FF In manual mode an integral term is calculated so that when transitioning back to auto mode, the output is bumpless (a step change in the output doesn't occur).
      Parameters:
      PV - - double - Process variable (measured) value, in "PV" units.
      SP - - double - Setpoint value, in "PV" units.
      FF - - double - Feedforward value, in "PV" units.
      auto - - boolean - TRUE when in auto mode. FALSE for manual mode.
      systemTime - - double -
      Returns:
      CO - double - calculated control output value.

    • inRange

      public static boolean inRange(double value, double min, double max)
      Utility function to determine if a value is within the range of values provided.
      Parameters:
      value - - double - value to check.
      min - - double - minmum limit value
      max - - double - maximum limit value.
      Returns:
      inRange - boolean - TRUE when input value isn't outside the limit values.

    • modulusError

      public static double modulusError(double Reference_SP, double Measurement_PV, double minimumInput, double maximumInput)
      Utility function to calculate the modulus error for a system with continuous PV and SP. If the PV or SP values overflow their limits, their modulus values are calculated and used. The calcualted error is also considered to be a modulus value.
      Parameters:
      Reference_SP - - double - Current setpoint value.
      Measurement_PV - - double - Current process variable value.
      minimumInput - - double - Minimum input limit value
      maximumInput - - double - Maximum input limit value.
      Returns:
      modulusError - double - Calculated error value.

    • getKi

      public double getKi()
      Returns the value of Ki, which is the integral gain constant.
      Returns:
      Ki - double - Integral gain constant.

    • getKp

      public double getKp()
      Returns the value of Kp, which is the proportional gain constant.
      Returns:
      Kp - double - Proprotional gain constant.

    • getKd

      public double getKd()
      Returns the value of Kd, which is the derivative gain constant.
      Returns:
      Kd - double - Derivative gain constant.

    • getKf

      public double getKf()
      Returns the value of Kf, which is the feedforward gain constant.
      Returns:
      Kf - double - Feedforward gain constant.

    • getKn

      public double getKn()
      Returns value of Kn, which is the normalization gain factor. This constant is normally calculated as maximum output divided by process variable value at maximum output. This can be set to 1.0 to not do normalization. Using normalization can help simplify determining the other gain constants.
      Returns:
      Kn - double - Normalization constant.

    • getPeriod

      public double getPeriod()
      Returns the last execution period in seconds. This is the difference in time between the most recent and previous PID execute calls. This is the same ass getLastPeriod.
      Returns:
      lastPeriod - double - Last period in seconds.

    • getLastPeriod

      public double getLastPeriod()
      Returns the last execution period in seconds. This is the difference in time between the most recent and previous PID execute calls.
      Returns:
      lastPeriod - double - Last period in seconds.

    • getError

      public double getError()
      Returns the current controller control error value. (Sometimes this is also reffered to as position error. )
      Returns:
      controlError - double - current control error.

    • getPositionError

      public double getPositionError()
      Returns the current controller control error value. (Sometimes this is also reffered to as position error. ). This function is the same as getError().
      Returns:
      controlError - double - current control error.

    • getVelocityError

      public double getVelocityError()
      Returns the rate of error change. This is calculated as ( current Error - last error ) / period. This is sometimes referred to as Velocity Error, which can be confusing since the units are not likely velocity units.
      Returns:
      errorChangeRate - double - Rate of change of the calcualted error value.

    • getSetpoint

      public double getSetpoint()
      Returns the current setpoint value.
      Returns:
      setpoint - double - current setpoint value.

    • getContinuousInput

      public boolean getContinuousInput()
      Returns TRUE when the continuous input configuration parameters is TRUE.
      Returns:
      continuousInput - boolean - Returns TRUE when continuous input configuration is set.

    • getMinInput

      public double getMinInput()
      Get the minimum input limit value. This is only used when continuous input is set to TRUE.
      Returns:
      minInputLimit - double - Returns the current value of the minimum input limit.

    • getMaxInput

      public double getMaxInput()
      Get the maximum input limit value. This is only used when continuous input is set to TRUE.
      Returns:
      maxInputLimit - double - Returns the current value of the maximum input limit.

    • getAntiWindupActive

      public boolean getAntiWindupActive()
      Returns TRUE when integral anti-windup is being performed.
      Returns:
      antiWindupActive - boolean - TRUE when anti-windup logic is changing the integral total.

    • setKd

      public void setKd(double Kd)
      Set the derivative gain constant, Kd. This value is multiplied by the normalization constant, Kn before being applied. If Kn is 1.0, then this is in "output" relative units. Otherwise this is in "PV" relative units.
      Parameters:
      Kd - - double - New derivative gain constant.

    • setKp

      public void setKp(double Kp)
      Set the proportional gain constant, Kp. This value is multiplied by the normalization constant, Kn before being applied. If Kn is 1.0, then this is in "output" relative units. Otherwise this is in "PV" relative units.
      Parameters:
      Kp - - double - New proportional gain constant.

    • setKi

      public void setKi(double Ki)
      Set the integral gain constant, Ki. This value is multiplied by the normalization constant, Kn before being applied. If Kn is 1.0, then this is in "output" relative units. Otherwise this is in "PV" relative units.
      Parameters:
      Ki - - double - New integral gain constant.

    • setDerivativeFilter

      public void setDerivativeFilter(boolean filterDerivative)
      Sets if derivative filtering should be performed when calculting the derivative value to add to the control output. When TRUE the derivative is calculated as the average of the last three raw derivative values. This defaults to FALSE if not set.
      Parameters:
      filterDerivative - - boolean - If TRUE causes derivative to be filtered.

    • setIntegralRange

      public void setIntegralRange(double minIntegral, double maxIntegral)
      Sets the minimum and maximum allowed integral term. This is in "CO" units. Settings these values to a fraction of the minimum and maximum allowed output can help to minimize integral windup, which most often occurs after a significant setpoint change causing the error to be relatively large for a relatively long period of time. Note that this does not prevent integral windup when the setpoint and output are close to their high or low limits. These default to very large (almost infinite) positive and negative values if not set.
      Parameters:
      minIntegral - - double - Minimum integral output value.
      maxIntegral - - double - Maximum integral output value.

    • setIntegralZone

      public void setIntegralZone(double integralZone)
      Sets the integral zone. The absolute value of the calculated error must be within this value to allow the PID to calculate and use an integral term. This can help prevent the integral term from winding up when the setpoint is moving, but the process variable is lagging behind. If not specified, the default value is 9.9E+30. This value is specified in "PV" relative units. This defaults to a vary large (almost infinite) value if not set.
      Parameters:
      integralZone - - double - New value for integral zone.

    • setOutputLimits

      public void setOutputLimits(double minOutput, double maxOutput)
      Sets the minimum and maximum value of the controller output (CO). Setting these allows integral windup logic to operate properly, in additional forcing the output to be within these limits. If not set these values default to very large (almost infinite) negative and positive values.
      Parameters:
      minOutput - - double - Sets smallest allowed value for controller output (CO)
      maxOutput - - double - Sets largest allowed value for controller output (CO)

    • setPID

      public void setPID(double Kp, double Ki, double Kd)
      Set new tuning constants for Kp, Ki, and Kd. These take effect immediately upon the next call to the Exec function.
      Parameters:
      Kp - - double - New Proportional gain constant.
      Ki - - double - New Integral gain constant.
      Kd - - double - New Derivative gain constant.

    • setPIDF

      public void setPIDF(double Kp, double Ki, double Kd, double Kf)
      Set new tuning constants for Kp, Ki, Kd, and Kf. These take effect immediately upon the next call to the Exec function.
      Parameters:
      Kp - - double - New Proportional gain constant.
      Ki - - double - New Integral gain constant.
      Kd - - double - New Derivative gain constant.
      Kf - - double - New Feedforware gain constant.

    • setPIDFN

      public void setPIDFN(double Kp, double Ki, double Kd, double Kf, double Kn)
      Set new tuning constants for Kp, Ki, Kd, Kf, and Kn. These take effect immediately upon the next call to the Exec function. Internally the new Kp, Ki, Kd, and Kf values are affected by the new Kn value.
      Parameters:
      Kp - - double - New Proportional gain constant.
      Ki - - double - New Integral gain constant.
      Kd - - double - New Derivative gain constant.
      Kf - - double - New Feedforware gain constant.
      Kn - - double - New Normalization gain constant. When this is 1.0, tuning constants have "CO" relative units, otherwise tuning constants have "PV" relative units.

    • setTolerance

      public void setTolerance(double posTolerance)
      Set the error tolerance in "PV" relative units.. (This is sometimes also called position tolerance). This sets the value used to determine if the controller is "AtSetpoint". This value is not used by the control logic to calculate the control output. If not set, the default is 0.0.
      Parameters:
      posTolerance - - double - New error tolerance value in "PV" units.

    • setTolerancePV

      public void setTolerancePV(double posTolerance, double velTolerance)
      Set the error tolerance in "PV" relative units and the error rate of change tolerance in "PV/Sec" units. (These are sometimes also called position and velocity tolerances). This sets the values used to determine if the controller is "AtSetpoint". These values are not used by the control logic to calculate the control output. If not set, the defaults are 0.0 and infinite.
      Parameters:
      posTolerance - - double - Error tolerance in "PV" units.
      velTolerance - - double - Error rate of change tolerance in "PV/Sec" units.

    • setContinuousInput

      public void setContinuousInput(boolean continuousInput, double minInput, double maxInput)
      Sets if the Process Variable and Setpoint are continuous. This occurs when the maximum value wraps around to the minimum value. This most often occurs when controlling a circular angle which wraps from PI to -PI. If this function is not caled, the default is FALSE. The minimum and maximum input limits are also set with this method. Note that the actual PV and SP can exceed the input limits. When this occurs, the modulus of these values based on the input limits are used.
      Parameters:
      continuousInput - - boolean - Sets continuous input when TRUE.
      minInput - - double - minimum value of input.
      maxInput - - double - maximum value of input.
